content.body: hallo  every body

Hello, all.
I just noticed a small typo in a section's id in the DOM specs and am not sure what's the best action (since this is used as link, maybe in many places). The section is https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#action-versus-occurance I guess fixing it is not worth the trouble of potentially breaking existing links? (The readable text is fine)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text:
Hello, all.
I just noticed a small typo in a section's id in the DOM specs and am not sure what's the best action (since this is used as link, maybe in many places). The section is https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#action-versus-occurance I guess fixing it is not worth the trouble of potentially breaking existing links? (The readable text is fine)

content.body: Howdy Kaiido: it’s possible to add a new ID while preserving the existing ID
content.formatted_body: Howdy Kaiido: it’s possible to add a new ID while preserving the existing ID

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Howdy Kaiido: it’s possible to add a new ID while preserving the existing ID
Howdy Kaiido: it’s possible to add a new ID while preserving the existing ID

content.body: Usually ID's are autogenerated from the heading text, at least in Bikeshed, and if this one isn't, it might be because the typo was fixed in the heading but the ID had to stay the same to avoid breaking links

content.body: https://ian.hixie.ch/bible/english
but I think Hixie always had the spec as `lang=en-US-hixie` so that _“initialisation”_ would have always been a bug anyway

content.body: When adding spec data to JS objects, I've seen some people use internal slots, whereas others just say "SomeObject has a <dfn for="SomeObject">thing</dfn>". Is there a 'right' way?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: When adding spec data to JS objects, I've seen some people use internal slots, whereas others just say "SomeObject has a <dfn for="SomeObject">thing</dfn>". Is there a 'right' way?

content.body: I usually just do the latter
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I usually just do the latter

content.body: Also, if a callback is put in an internal slot, does it impact the `this` value in the callback when it's called?
content.formatted_body: Also, if a callback is put in an internal slot, does it impact the this value in the callback when it's called?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Also, if a callback is put in an internal slot, does it impact the `this` value in the callback when it's called?
Also, if a callback is put in an internal slot, does it impact the this value in the callback when it's called?

content.body: I prefer the latter, and am somewhat responsible for introducing the former
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I prefer the latter, and am somewhat responsible for introducing the former

content.body: Is a callback a Web IDL callback, or an algorithm? Web IDL callbacks need to be called with specific thisArgs via https://webidl.spec.whatwg.org/#invoke-a-callback-function
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Is a callback a Web IDL callback, or an algorithm? Web IDL callbacks need to be called with specific thisArgs via https://webidl.spec.whatwg.org/#invoke-a-callback-function
